Definition of the characteristic-based a: Absolute value of acc.

Annual income before extraordinary items (ib) minus operating cash flows (oancf) divided by average total assets (at); if oancf is missing then set to change in act - change in che - change in lct + change in dlc + change in txp-dp.

Average daily trading volume (vol) for 3 days around earnings announcement minus average daily volume for 1-month ending 2 weeks before earnings announcement divided by 1-month average daily volume. Earnings announcement day from Compustat quarterly (rdq).
Number of years since first Compustat coverage.
Annual percent change in total assets (at).
Monthly average of daily bid-ask spread divided by average of daily spread.
Estimated market beta from weekly returns and equal weighted market returns for 3 years ending month t-1 with at least 52 weeks of returns.
Market beta squared.
Book value of equity (ceq) divided by end of fiscal-year-end market capitalization.
Industry adjusted book-to-market ratio.
Cash and cash equivalents divided by average total assets.
Earnings before depreciation and extraordinary items (ib+dp) divided by avg. total liabilities (lt).
Fiscal year end market capitalization plus long term debt (dltt) minus total assets (at) divided by cash and equivalents (che).
Operating cash flows divided by fiscal-year-end market capitalization.
Industry adjusted cfp.
2-digit SIC - fiscal-year mean adjusted change in sales (sale) divided by average total assets (at).
Annual percent change in shares outstanding (csho).
Industry-adjusted change in number of employees.
Mean analyst forecast in month prior to fiscal period end date from I/B/E/S summary file minus same mean forecast for prior fiscal period using annual earnings forecasts.
Change in inventory (inv) scaled by average total assets (at).
Cumulative returns from months t-6 to t-1 minus months t-12 to t-7.
Change in nanalyst from month t-3 to month t.
2-digit SIC - fiscal-year mean adjusted change in income before extraordinary items (ib) divided by sales (sale).
Percent change in total taxes (txtq) from quarter t-4 to t.
Change over one quarter in net PP&E (ppentq) divided by sales (saleq) - average of this variable for prior 3 quarters; if saleq = 0, then scale by 0.01.
An indicator equal to 1 if company has convertible debt obligations.
Current assets / current liabilities.
Depreciation divided by PP&E.

Standard deviation of analyst forecasts in month prior to fiscal period end date divided by the absolute value of the mean forecast; if meanest = 0, then scalar set to 1. Forecast data from I/B/E/S summary files.
An indicator variable equal to 1 if company pays dividends but did not in prior year.
An indicator variable equal to 1 if company does not pay dividend but did in prior year.
Natural log of trading volume times price per share from month t-2.
Total dividends (dvt) divided by market capitalization at fiscal year-end.
Sum of daily returns in three days around earnings announcement. Earnings announcement from Compustat quarterly file (rdq).
Annual percent change in book value of equity (ceq).
Annual income before extraordinary items (ib) divided by end of fiscal year market cap.
Most recently available analyst forecasted 5-year growth.
Revenues (revt) minus cost of goods sold (cogs) divided by lagged total assets (at).
Percent change in capital expenditures from year t-2 to year t.
Growth in long term net operating assets.
2-digit SIC - fiscal-year sales concentration (sum of squared percent of sales in industry for each company).
Percent change in number of employees (emp).
Standard deviation of residuals of weekly returns on weekly equal weighted market returns for 3 years prior to month end.
Average of daily (absolute return / dollar volume).
Equal weighted average industry 12-month returns.
Annual change in gross property, plant, and equipment (ppegt) + annual change in inventories (invt) all scaled by lagged total assets (at).
An indicator variable equal to 1 if first year available on CRSP monthly stock file.
Total liabilities (lt) divided by fiscal year end market capitalization.
Annual percent change in total liabilities (lt).
Maximum daily return from returns during calendar month t-1.
11-month cumulative returns ending one month before month end.
1-month cumulative return.
Cumulative returns from months t-36 to t-13.
5-month cumulative returns ending one month before month end.
Sum of 8 indicator variables for fundamental performance.
Natural log of market capitalization at end of month t-1.
2-digit SIC industry-adjusted fiscal year-end market capitalization.
Number of analyst forecasts from most recently available I/B/E/S summary files in month prior to month of portfolio formation.  nanalyst set to zero if not covered in I/B/E/S summary file.
Number of consecutive quarters (up to eight quarters) with an increase in earnings (ibq) over same quarter in the prior year.
Revenue minus cost of goods sold - SG&A expense - interest expense divided by lagged common shareholders' equity.
Capitalized SG&A expenses.
2-digit SIC - fiscal-year mean adjusted percent change in capital expenditures (capx).
Percent change in currat.
Percent change in depr.
Percent change in gross margin (sale-cogs) minus percent change in sales (sale).
Percent change in quick.
Annual percent change in sales (sale) minus annual percent change in inventory (invt).
Annual percent change in sales (sale) minus annual percent change in receivables (rect).
Annual percent change in sales (sale) minus annual percent change in SG&A (xsga).
Percent change in saleinv.
Same as acc except that the numerator is divided by the absolute value of ib; if ib = 0 then ib set to 0.01 for denominator.
The proportion of variation in weekly returns for 36 months ending in month t explained by 4 lags of weekly market returns incremental to contemporaneous market return.
Sum of 9 indicator variables to form fundamental health score.
(current assets - inventory) / current liabilities.
An indicator variable equal to 1 if R&D expense as a percentage of total assets has an increase greater than 5%.
R&D expense divided by end-of-fiscal-year market capitalization.
R&D expense divided by sales (xrd/sale).
Buildings and capitalized leases divided by gross PP&E.
Standard deviation of daily returns from month t-1.
Income before extraordinary items (ibq) divided by one quarter lagged total assets (atq).
Standard deviaiton for 16 quarters of income before extraordinary items (ibq) divided by average total assets (atq).
Earnings before extraordinary items divided by lagged common shareholders' equity.
Annual earnings before interest and taxes (ebit) minus non-operating income (nopi) divided by non-cash enterprise value (ceq+lt-che).
Sales from quarter t minus sales from quarter t-4 (saleq) divided by fiscal-quarter-end market capitalization (cshoq * prccq).
Annual sales divided by cash and cash equivalents.
Annual sales divided by total inventory.
Annual sales divided by accounts receivable.
Total liability scaled secured debt.
An indicator equal to 1 if company has secured debt obligations.

Analysts mean annual earnings forecast for nearest upcoming fiscal year from most recent month available prior to month of portfolio formation from I/B/E/S summary files scaled by price per share at fiscal quarter end.
Annual percent change in sales (sale).
An indicator variable equal to 1 if a company's primary industry classification is in smoke or tobacco, beer or alcohol, or gaming.
Annual revenue (sale) divided by fiscal-year-end market capitalization.
Monthly standard deviation of daily dollar trading volume.
Monthly standard deviation of daily share turnover.
Standard deviation for 16 quarters of accruals (acc measured with quarterly Compustat) scaled by sales; if saleq = 0, then scale by 0.01.
Standard deviation for 16 quarters of cash flows divided by sales (saleq); if saleq = 0, then scale by 0.01. Cash flows defined as ibq minus quarterly accruals.

Unexpected quarterly earnings divided by fiscal-quarter-end market cap.  Unexpected earnings is I/B/E/S actual earnings minus median forecasted earnings if available, else it is the seasonally differenced quarterly earnings before extraordinary items from Compustat quarterly file.
Cash holdings + 0.715 × receivables + 0.547 × inventory + 0.535 × PPE/
total assets.
Tax income, calculated from current tax expense divided by maximum federal tax rate, divided by income before extraordinary items.
Average monthly trading volume for most recent 3 months scaled by number of shares outstanding in current month.
Turnover weighted number of zero trading days for most recent 1 month.
